BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: UNITED ARTS COUNCIL OF GREENSBORO INC

DoingBusinessAsName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO (THE ACGG) IS DEDICATED TO FOSTERING CREATIVITY AND ENRICHING THE CULTURAL LIVES OF ALL RESIDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO (THE ACGG) IS DEDICATED TO FOSTERING CREATIVITY AND ENRICHING THE CULTURAL LIVES OF ALL RESIDENTS. THE ACGG STRIVES TO SUPPORT, PROMOTE, AND ELEVATE LOCAL ARTS AND CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS, MAKING A LASTING IMPACT IN THE COMMUNITY. FOUNDED IN 1960, THE ACGG IS FOCUSED ON THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE ARTS ECOSYSTEM ACROSS GUILFORD COUNTY, PROMOTING THE ARTS AS AN ECONOMIC DRIVER AND INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS THAT BUILD PARTNERSHIPS, COLLABORATION, AND COOPERATION ACROSS THE SECTOR. KEY PROGRAMS INCLUDED SHARED SERVICES, GRANTS, MARKETING SUPPORT, ADVOCACY, AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT.
IRS990.Desc: THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO, FOUNDED IN 1960, WAS INITIALLY ESTABLISHED AS A STEWARD OF FUNDING FOR THE ARTS COMMUNITY. TODAY, THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO NOT ONLY INVESTS IN MORE THAN 50 ARTS ORGANIZATIONS, PROJECTS, TEACHERS, AND ARTISTS BY AWARDING RESOURCES THROUGH A VARIETY OF COMPETITIVE GRANT PROGRAMS, BUT ALSO PROVIDES STRATEGIC LEADERSHIP, ADVOCACY, COLLABORATIVE INITIATIVES, MARKETING, AND PROMOTIONAL SERVICES, AND HAS SERVED AS AN "INCUBATOR" FOR MANY EMERGING ARTS ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS THE NORTH CAROLINA FOLK FESTIVAL AND CASA AZUL. THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO MANAGED THE VAN DYKE PERFORMANCE SPACE LOCATED IN THE GREENSBORO CULTURAL CENTER AND THE HISTORIC STERNBERGER ARTISTS CENTER.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SHARED SERVICES PROVIDES BACK-OFFICE SUPPORT INCLUDING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, BUDGET DEVELOPMENT, CASH FLOW ANALYSIS AND CONTRACT NEGOTIATIONS, AT BELOW-MARKET RATES FOR NON-PROFIT ARTS ORGANIZATIONS. THE PROGRAM IS A MEANS OF BUILDING INTERNAL CAPACITY WITHIN SMALL AND EMERGING ARTS ORGANIZATIONS, ASSISTING IN THEIR GROWTH AND LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY, AND PROVIDING AFFORDABLE ACCESS TO FINANCIAL PLANNING TOOLS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: STERNBERGER ARTISTS CENTER - OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO TO PROVIDE LOW COST STUDIOS FOR ARTISTS. THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OPERATING EXPENSES AND CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE FACILITY, FUNDED IN PART BY RENTAL INCOME FROM THE STUDIOS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES AND MAINTAINS STERNBERGER ARTISTS' CENTER WHICH IS LOCATED ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES AND OFFERS AFFORDABLE STUDIOS TO INDIVIDUAL ARTISTS.

THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO HAS TWO ENDOWMENT FUNDS THAT ARE MANAGED BY CFGG. UNDER THE TERMS OF THE AGREEMENTS, CFGG MANAGES THE FUNDS TO PROTECT THE VALUE OF THE PRINCIPAL. THE ARTSGREENSBORO ENDOWMENT FUND ("ENDOWMENT FUND") WAS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS A GENERAL ENDOWMENT TO SUPPORT FUTURE OPERATIONS AND SPECIAL PROJECTS OF THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENBSORO. THE ARTSGREENSBORO LEGACY ENDOWMENT FUND ("LEGACY FUND") WAS ESTABLISHED IN MARCH 2022 TO UNDERWRITE THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES OF THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO. THE LEGACY FUND IS DONOR RESTRICTED.

ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ORGANIZATION AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY OR ASSET IF THE ORGANIZATION HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR ASSET OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. CURRENTLY, NO TAX EXAMINATIONS ARE IN PROGRESS OR ANTICIPATED. THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO, BY EXPIRATION OF THE STATUE OF LIMITATIONS, IS GENERALLY NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2019.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GANT SCHOOL OF MUSIC AND JAZZ
GREEN HILL CENTER FOR NORTH CAROLINA ART INC
HIGH POINT AREA ARTS COUNCIL INC
THE CHORAL ARTS COLLECTIVE (BEL CANTO COMPANY INC)
THE MUSIC ACADEMY OF NORTH CAROLINA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: APPLICANTS MUST DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY COLLECT AND TRACK DATA REQUIRED BY THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO IN ITS REPORTING MATERIALS. EXAMPLES INCLUDE INFORMATION SUCH AS THE ETHNICITY OF PARTICIPANTS, NUMBER OF SENIORS, VETERANS, WOMEN, DISABLED, AND STUDENTS ON FREE AND REDUCED LUNCH.

MISSION SUPPORT IS COMPETITIVE SINGLE-YEAR PROGRAM FOR MATURE ARTS ORGANIZATIONS WITH UNRESTRICTED OPERATING REVENUE EXCEEDING $500,000 ANNUALLY FOR THE PAST THREE (3) CONSECUTIVE YEARS. APPLICANTS MUST HAVE A DEMONSTRATED RECORD OF SUCCESS IN CREATING OR PRESENTING PROGRAMS OF THE HIGHEST ARTISTIC MERIT AND REGIONAL SIGNIFICANCE AND FURTHER ALL THREE OF THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO'S STRATEGIC PRIORITIES. MISSION SUPPORT GRANT PROGRAM IS FUNDED BY FOUNDATIONS, CORPORATIONS, AND INDIVIDUAL DONORS.

GRASSROOTS GRANTS ARE A CORNERSTONE OF THE GRANT PROGRAM AT THE ACGG. FUNDED BY THE NORTH CAROLINA ARTS COUNCIL WITH A 1:1 MATCH, THESE GRANTS PROVIDE OPERATING AND PROJECT SUPPORT FOR ORGANIZATIONS LED BY INDIVIDUALS OF COLOR OR PRIMARILY SERVING GUILFORD COUNTY'S MULTICULTURAL COMMUNITY. THE ACGG CO-MANAGES THIS PROGRAM WITH THE HIGH POINT ARTS COUNCIL. IT IS A COMPETITIVE GRANT PROGRAM FUNDED ANNUALLY.

ARTIST SUPPORT GRANTS, FUNDED BY THE NORTH CAROLINA ARTS COUNCIL, ARE AVAILABLE FOR ARTISTS IN ALL DISCIPLINES TO SUPPORT THEIR PROFESSIONAL AND ARTISTIC DEVELOPMENT. THE ARTS COUNCIL OF GREATER GREENSBORO PROVIDES GRANTS RANGING FROM $500 TO $2,000 IN THE FOLLOWING COUNTIES: DAVIDSON, DAVIE, FORSYTH, GUILFORD, AND RANDOLPH.

COMMUNITY ELEVATION GRANT PROGRAM IS FOCUSED ON COMMUNITIES AND NEIGHBORHOODS IN THE GREATER GREENSBORO REGION THAT HAVE BEEN UNDER-INVESTED AND LEFT BEHIND. THE ACGG LEADS THE ARTS-BASED GRANT PROGRAM WITH SIGNIFICANT INPUT FROM COMMUNITY NEIGHBORHOOD STAKEHOLDERS.

THE ORGANIZATION OF COLOR COHORT IS A PILOT PROGRAM OF THE ACGG. THE OOCC WORKS WITH FOUR BIPOC-LED ORGANIZATIONS FOR A PERIOD OF FIVE TO SEVEN YEARS. THE OCGG PROVIDES INTENTIONAL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, CAPACITY BUILDING, COACHING, MENTORING, AND UNRESTRICTED OPERATING SUPPORT. THE GOAL IS TO STRENGTHEN THE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE OF THE SELECTED ORGANIZATIONS AND DEVELOP LEADERS FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS OF COLOR.

THE NEW CREATIVE INVESTMENT IS A PROGRAM FUNDED BY THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT SUPPORT FROM GUILFORD COUNTY AND THE NORTH CAROLINA ARTS COUNCIL, TOTALING $3,019,812. WITH THESE FUNDS, THE ACGG IS FOCUSED ON: 1. BUILDING THE SUSTAINABILITY AND RESILIENCY OF ARTS NONPROFITS; 2. EQUIPPING ARTISTS WITH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TOOLS; 3. PILOTING AN ARTIST-IN-RESIDENCE PROGRAM TO DELIVER AN ARTS-INTEGRATED CURRICULUM FOR BETTER EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR TITLE 1 THIRD-GRADERS; AND 4. DEVELOPING A MULTIFACETED MARKETING CAMPAIGN, "ARTS ACROSS GUILFORD," TO DRIVE TOURISM AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO LAURA WAY, CURRENT PRESIDENT/CEO OF THE ORGANIZATION, TO REVIEW AND SUGGEST ANY CHANGES THAT NEED TO BE MADE BEFORE FILING WITH IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS AND BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO READ AND SIGN ANNUALLY A STATEMENT STATING THAT TO THE BEST OF THEIR KNOWLEDGE THEY HAVE NOT BEEN IN A POSITION OF POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTERESTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ACTS AS THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD WHICH CONSISTS OF THE CHAIR, THE CHAIR-ELECT, THE SECRETARY AND THE TREASURER, REVIEW THE PRESIDENT'S PERFORMANCE AND ENFORCE, REVIEW AND REVISE, IF NECESSARY, PERSONNEL POLICIES GOVERNING THE STAFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR THE ORGANIZATION PRODUCES AN ANNUAL REPORT THAT IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON ITS WEBSITE. THIS REPORT INCLUDES FINANCIAL INFORMATION FROM THE ANNUAL AUDIT, LIST OF DONORS AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ALL OTHER INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A(25), COLUMN F
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER COMPENSATION FROM THE ORGANIZATION FOR LAURA WAY, CURRENT PRESIDENT & CEO, HAS NOT BEEN INCLUDED ON THIS SCHEDULE. IN ORDER TO COMPLY WITH FORM 990 FILING REQUIREMENTS, THIS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CONTRACTUAL SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 179,280. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 24,697. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 56,360. TOTAL EXPENSES 260,337.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SHARED SERVICES TO BUILD FINANCIAL CAPACITY LLC
